label: Food, Poverty and Development
description: Economic theory and empirical analyses are used to study economic development, emphasizing the structural transformation of an economy, poverty alleviation among households, improvement in food security and public policies to support those processes. Topics include poverty measurement, poverty dynamics, growth theory, and impact evaluation. Special attention is paid to the role of the agricultural sector and rural development. Prerequisite: ACE 500 or ACE 504 or ECON 500 and basic econometrics.
courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: ACE 500 or ACE 504 or ECON 500 and basic econometrics.
sectionDeptRestriction: Restricted to students in the Agr & Consumer Economics department.
